Description: A flat bangle of horn or tortoise-shell: with some pieces broken from the outer rim and one piece from the inner. The surface, which is flaking, is much worn and is thinner in some places than in others. Although the piece has a dull, rough appearance in the hand, when it is held up to the light parts are translucent and of a rich brown colour.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 53; pl. XXV, 32; Grave register, pl. VIII.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (15)
